faq.question: How long can DJI Mavic 3 record on 256GB?
faq.answer: With 4K 60fps at 150Mbps, you can record approximately 3.7 hours on a 256GB card. For 5.1K at 200Mbps, it's about 2.8 hours.

faq.answer: While V30 is the minimum for standard modes, DJI strongly recommends V60-rated cards for 4K 120fps and Apple ProRes recording to ensure no dropped frames.

faq.question: What's the difference between H.264 and H.265 on Mavic 3?
faq.answer: H.265 (HEVC) provides better compression, allowing you to store approximately 30% more footage compared to H.264 at the same quality level, but requires more processing power to edit.

faq.answer: A 256GB V90 card can only hold about 18 minutes of 5.8K 30fps ProRes footage, which has a massive bitrate of 1900Mbps. This mode is for professional productions where quality is paramount.

faq.question: Why do I need a V90 card for the S5 IIX?
faq.answer: A V90-rated SD card is mandatory for the camera's highest-quality internal recording modes, including all ALL-Intra and ProRes options, due to their extremely high bitrates (up to 1.9Gbps).

contentChunks.heroText: The Indie Filmmaker's Dream. Storage Mastered.
contentChunks.introParagraph: The Panasonic Lumix S5 IIX is a video powerhouse, offering internal ProRes and high-bitrate ALL-I codecs. Our calculator is an essential tool for any S5 IIX user to plan for the massive file sizes these professional formats create.

panasonic-lumix-s5-iix.notes: The S5 IIX is identical to the S5 II but unlocks advanced video features like ProRes recording and direct-to-SSD recording via USB-C. It has dual UHS-II SD card slots.
commonIssues: ProRes and ALL-I files consume storage at an incredible rate.
The sheer number of video formats and settings can be overwhelming for new users.
Requires a very fast computer for a smooth editing experience.

seo.title: Panasonic Lumix S5 II Storage Calculator | 6K Video & PDAF
seo.description: Calculate storage for the Panasonic Lumix S5 II. Plan for its 6K 30fps video and take advantage of its highly-anticipated phase-detect autofocus.

faq.question: What card do I need for 6K video on the Lumix S5 II?
faq.answer: To record 6K 30fps video at 200Mbps, Panasonic recommends a V60-rated UHS-II SD card.

faq.question: What was the big upgrade with the S5 II?
faq.answer: The Lumix S5 II was Panasonic's first camera to incorporate phase-detect autofocus (PDAF), a massive improvement for video and photo focus tracking compared to their previous contrast-detect-only systems.

contentChunks.heroText: The Hybrid Workhorse, Evolved. Capacity Calculated.
contentChunks.introParagraph: The Panasonic Lumix S5 II is a superb all-around hybrid camera, featuring 6K video and a new, highly effective autofocus system. Our calculator helps you choose the right SD cards for your photo and video projects.

panasonic-lumix-s5-ii.notes: The S5 II features dual UHS-II SD card slots for professional backup or relay recording. It offers incredible value for a full-frame hybrid camera.
commonIssues: Lacks the internal ProRes and ALL-I codecs of the more expensive S5 IIX model.
The menu system is extensive and can take time to learn.
The body is larger and heavier than some competitors.

seo.title: Nikon D850 Storage Calculator | 45MP RAW & XQD/SD
seo.description: Calculate storage for the legendary Nikon D850 DSLR. Plan for its huge 45.7MP RAW files and understand its dual XQD and SD card system.

faq.question: How large are the RAW files from the Nikon D850?
faq.answer: A 14-bit lossless compressed RAW file from the D850's 45.7MP sensor is about 55MB. A 128GB card can hold approximately 2300 of these high-resolution images.

faq.question: Why does the D850 use two different card types?
faq.answer: The D850 has one XQD slot (which also accepts CFexpress Type B cards with a firmware update) and one UHS-II SD slot. The XQD/CFexpress slot is significantly faster and is essential for achieving the camera's maximum 9fps burst rate and quickly clearing the buffer.

contentChunks.heroText: The DSLR, Perfected. Storage Mastered.
contentChunks.introParagraph: The Nikon D850 is widely considered one of the greatest DSLRs ever made, with a phenomenal 45.7MP sensor. Our calculator helps you manage its large RAW files across its dual XQD and SD card slots.

nikon-d850.notes: For best performance, use a fast XQD or CFexpress card in the primary slot. The SD slot can be used for backup, overflow, or sorting JPEGs.
commonIssues: Live View autofocus is slow compared to any modern mirrorless camera.
It is a large and heavy camera body, typical of a pro-level DSLR.
XQD/CFexpress cards are more expensive than SD cards.

seo.title: Nikon D750 Storage Calculator | Full-Frame DSLR Capacity
seo.description: Calculate storage for the classic Nikon D750 full-frame DSLR. Plan your capacity for 24MP RAW files and 1080p video.

faq.question: What SD card does the Nikon D750 use?
faq.answer: The D750 has dual UHS-I SD card slots. A standard V30 card is more than enough for its 1080p video and 6.5fps burst shooting.

faq.question: Is the Nikon D750 still a good camera?
faq.answer: Yes, the D750 is a beloved camera that still produces beautiful 24MP images. It's an incredible value on the used market for photographers moving to full-frame.

contentChunks.heroText: The Full-Frame Classic. Storage Solved.
contentChunks.introParagraph: The Nikon D750 was a hugely popular full-frame DSLR known for its excellent image quality and versatile performance. Our calculator helps you plan storage for this reliable workhorse.

nikon-d750.notes: The D750 was one of the first Nikon DSLRs to feature a tilting screen, a great feature for photographers. It has dual UHS-I SD card slots for backup.
commonIssues: Video capabilities are limited to 1080p.
Live View autofocus is slow and not ideal for video.
Early models were subject to a recall for an internal flare issue.

seo.title: Nikon Z6 III Storage Calculator | 6K N-RAW & 4K 120p
seo.description: Calculate storage for the powerhouse Nikon Z6 III. Plan for massive internal 6K N-RAW video files and high-bitrate 4K 120fps H.265 video.

faq.question: What card do I need to record 6K RAW on the Z6 III?
faq.answer: Internal 6K 60fps N-RAW recording at its 3584Mbps bitrate is extremely demanding and requires a fast CFexpress Type B card. It cannot be recorded to an SD card.

faq.question: How much 4K 120fps video fits on a 128GB SD card?
faq.answer: A 128GB V90-rated SD card can hold about 42 minutes of 4K 120fps H.265 video, which records at 400Mbps.

contentChunks.heroText: The Hybrid Perfected. Master Your Media.
contentChunks.introParagraph: With its 'partially stacked' sensor and internal 6K RAW recording, the Nikon Z6 III is a revolutionary hybrid camera. Our calculator is essential for managing the massive files from its professional video formats across CFexpress and SD cards.

nikon-z6-iii.notes: The Z6 III features one CFexpress Type B slot and one UHS-II SD slot. For any RAW or high-frame-rate video, the CFexpress card is mandatory.
commonIssues: CFexpress cards and readers are a significant additional investment.
RAW video workflows require a very powerful computer and large amounts of storage.
The number of video options can be overwhelming for beginners.

seo.title: Nikon Z6 II Storage Calculator | 4K Video & Dual Slots
seo.description: Calculate storage for the versatile Nikon Z6 II. Plan for 4K 60fps video and manage files across its CFexpress and SD card slots.

faq.question: What card does the Z6 II need for 4K 60fps?
faq.answer: For 4K 60fps video recording, which has a 250Mbps bitrate, Nikon recommends a V60-rated SD card or any CFexpress card.

faq.question: Why does the Z6 II have two different card slots?
faq.answer: The Z6 II has one CFexpress Type B slot for maximum speed (essential for long bursts) and one UHS-II SD slot for flexibility and cost-effectiveness. This was a key upgrade from the single slot on the original Z6.

contentChunks.heroText: The Versatile All-Rounder. Storage Planned.
contentChunks.introParagraph: The Nikon Z6 II is a highly capable full-frame mirrorless camera, perfect for a wide range of photo and video applications. Our calculator helps you plan your storage strategy across its dual card slots.

nikon-z6-ii.notes: The 4K 60fps video mode is subject to a slight APS-C crop. The addition of the second card slot was a major selling point for professionals.
commonIssues: Autofocus, while good, was considered a step behind competitors at the time of its release.
CFexpress cards provide the best performance but are more expensive than SD cards.

seo.title: DJI Mini 2 SE Storage Calculator | 2.7K Video Recording
seo.description: Calculate how much 2.7K video your budget-friendly DJI Mini 2 SE can store. Find the right microSD card for this excellent beginner drone.

faq.question: What is the best card for a DJI Mini 2 SE?
faq.answer: The Mini 2 SE records 2.7K video at 40Mbps. A standard Class 10 or U1 / V10 rated microSD card is sufficient, but a V30 card is also affordable and works perfectly.

faq.question: How long can a 64GB card record on the Mini 2 SE?
faq.answer: A 64GB card can hold over 3.5 hours of 2.7K video, which is plenty of storage for multiple flights.

contentChunks.heroText: Your First Drone Flight. Storage Made Simple.
contentChunks.introParagraph: The DJI Mini 2 SE is one of the best and most affordable ways to get started with drone flying. Our calculator helps you pick the right microSD card so you can focus on learning to fly and capture great 2.7K video.

dji-mini-2-se.notes: As a sub-250g drone, it has fewer flight restrictions in many countries. It uses the O2 transmission system, which is reliable for line-of-sight flying.
commonIssues: Lacks any obstacle avoidance sensors, requiring full manual control.
Not as stable in windy conditions as larger drones.
Video resolution is limited to 2.7K.

seo.title: Garmin Dash Cam Mini 2 Storage & Loop Recording Calculator
seo.description: Calculate how many hours of 1080p footage your tiny Garmin Dash Cam Mini 2 can loop record. Find out why High Endurance cards are critical.

faq.question: Why is a 'High Endurance' card critical for the Mini 2?
faq.answer: Like all dash cams, the Mini 2 constantly records and overwrites old footage. This intense cycle will quickly destroy a regular microSD card. High Endurance cards are specifically designed to withstand this 24/7 workload for years.

faq.question: How long will a 128GB card record on the Dash Cam Mini 2?
faq.answer: A 128GB High Endurance card will store approximately 18 hours of 1080p footage before the camera begins to overwrite the oldest files.

contentChunks.heroText: Your Invisible Witness. Storage, Solved.
contentChunks.introParagraph: The Garmin Dash Cam Mini 2 is one of the smallest and most discreet dash cams available. Our calculator helps you choose the right High Endurance microSD card to ensure it's always ready to capture what's important.

garmin-dash-cam-mini-2.notes: The camera has no screen and is controlled entirely through the Garmin Drive app on your smartphone. Format new cards within the app for best performance.
commonIssues: The camera can get hot to the touch during operation, which is normal.
Requires a constant power source via USB; has no internal battery for parking mode without a hardwire kit.
Initial pairing with the app can sometimes be finicky.

seo.title: Nikon Z5 Storage Calculator | Full-Frame Photo & Video
seo.description: Calculate storage for the entry-level full-frame Nikon Z5. Plan for 4K video and 24MP RAW files with its dual SD card slots.

faq.question: What SD card does the Nikon Z5 need for 4K video?
faq.answer: The Nikon Z5 records 4K video at 144Mbps and requires a V60-rated SD card. Using a V30 card may result in recording interruptions.

faq.question: Does the Z5 have dual card slots?
faq.answer: Yes, a key feature of the Z5 is its dual UHS-II SD card slots, which is great for backing up photos and videos in-camera—a feature often missing on entry-level models.

contentChunks.heroText: Full-Frame for All. Capacity Calculated.
contentChunks.introParagraph: The Nikon Z5 is an excellent and affordable gateway to full-frame mirrorless photography. Our calculator helps you choose the right SD cards to take full advantage of its dual slots and 4K video capabilities.

nikon-z5.notes: While the Z5 has dual UHS-II slots, its video and burst shooting speeds don't strictly require the fastest cards, making V60 cards a great-value pairing.
commonIssues: The 4K video mode is subject to a heavy 1.7x crop, making it difficult to get wide-angle shots.
The 4.5fps burst rate is slow for action photography.
The top screen is a simple mode dial, not the detailed info panel of higher-end models.

seo.title: Canon EOS R100 Storage Calculator | Beginner Mirrorless
seo.description: Calculate storage for Canon's most affordable RF-mount camera, the EOS R100. Plan capacity for its 4K video and 24MP photos.

faq.question: What card does the Canon R100 need?
faq.answer: For its cropped 4K 24fps video, a V30-rated SD card is required. For 1080p video or photography, a less expensive Class 10 or U1 card is sufficient.

faq.question: What are the limitations of the R100?
faq.answer: The R100 is a very basic camera. Its 4K video is heavily cropped and lacks Dual Pixel AF, the screen is fixed (not articulating), and it uses an older processor. It is designed purely as a simple, budget entry into the RF system.

contentChunks.heroText: The Simple Start to Mirrorless. Storage Made Easy.
contentChunks.introParagraph: The Canon EOS R100 is designed to be the simplest, most affordable entry point into the EOS R mirrorless system. Our calculator helps you find the right, cost-effective SD card for your needs.

canon-eos-r100.notes: This camera is aimed at absolute beginners. It has a single UHS-I SD card slot. Its limitations are significant compared to the R50 or R10.
commonIssues: 4K video is heavily cropped and uses a slow contrast-detect autofocus system.
Fixed rear LCD screen with no touch functionality.
Very slow burst shooting with autofocus.

seo.title: Sony A7R V Storage Calculator | 8K Video & 61MP RAW
seo.description: Calculate storage for the Sony A7R V. Plan for its massive 61MP RAW files, 8K video, and demanding codecs across CFexpress Type A and SD cards.

faq.question: What card do I need to record 8K video on the A7R V?
faq.answer: To record 8K 24fps video at 400Mbps, you must use a CFexpress Type A card. This format cannot be recorded to an SD card.

faq.question: How large are the RAW files from the A7R V?
faq.answer: A full-resolution, uncompressed 61MP RAW file is approximately 125MB. Even the lossless compressed option is around 65MB. This camera requires large-capacity, fast memory cards.

contentChunks.heroText: Resolution, Redefined. AI Autofocus. Storage, Mastered.
contentChunks.introParagraph: With its 61MP sensor and a dedicated AI-powered autofocus processor, the Sony A7R V is a technological marvel for high-resolution photographers. Our calculator is essential for managing the huge files it produces.

sony-a7r-v.notes: The A7R V features two dual-format card slots, each accepting either a CFexpress Type A card or a UHS-II SD card, offering incredible flexibility.
commonIssues: The cost of CFexpress Type A cards is a significant additional investment.
Massive 61MP files require a top-tier computer and vast storage for editing and archiving.
8K video recording is subject to a 1.2x crop.

seo.title: Nikon D3500 Storage Calculator | Beginner DSLR Capacity
seo.description: Calculate how much 1080p video and 24MP RAW photos your Nikon D3500 DSLR can store. Perfect for new photographers.

faq.question: What SD card does a Nikon D3500 use?
faq.answer: The D3500 is very efficient and only requires a standard Class 10 SD card for all its functions, including 1080p 60fps video.

faq.question: How many pictures can a 32GB card hold on a Nikon D3500?
faq.answer: A 32GB card can hold approximately 1200 RAW photos (at 25MB each) or over 4000 large JPEG photos (at 8MB each).

contentChunks.heroText: Learn Photography. Plan Your Storage.
contentChunks.introParagraph: The Nikon D3500 is one of the most recommended beginner DSLRs ever, thanks to its great image quality and helpful 'Guide' mode. Our calculator helps you pick an affordable SD card to start your photography journey.

nikon-d3500.notes: The D3500 is incredibly compact and lightweight for a DSLR. It has a single UHS-I SD card slot.
commonIssues: Live View autofocus is very slow.
The rear screen is fixed and not a touchscreen.
Video features are very basic and limited to 1080p.

seo.title: Sony ZV-E10 Storage Calculator | 4K Vlogging Capacity
seo.description: Calculate storage for the Sony ZV-E10. Plan for 4K video, interchangeable lenses, and features designed specifically for vloggers.

faq.question: What SD card do I need for 4K video on the ZV-E10?
faq.answer: To record 4K video in the high-quality XAVC S format at 100Mbps, the ZV-E10 requires a U3 / V30 rated SD card.

faq.question: What makes the ZV-E10 good for vlogging?
faq.answer: It combines a large APS-C sensor with a fully articulating screen, a high-quality built-in microphone, a dedicated 'Product Showcase' focus mode, and the ability to use any E-mount lens, making it incredibly versatile for content creators.

contentChunks.heroText: The Vlogger's Perfect Canvas. Storage Solved.
contentChunks.introParagraph: The Sony ZV-E10 is a purpose-built vlogging camera that offers the creative freedom of interchangeable lenses. Our calculator helps you choose the right V30 card to handle its high-quality 4K XAVC S video.

sony-zv-e10.notes: The ZV-E10 has a single UHS-I SD card slot. It lacks a built-in electronic viewfinder, relying entirely on the rear screen.
commonIssues: Lacks in-body image stabilization (IBIS), relying on lens stabilization.
Rolling shutter can be significant when moving the camera quickly.
The menu system can be complex for beginners.

seo.title: Sony a7 III Storage Calculator | Full-Frame Hybrid Classic
seo.description: Calculate storage for the legendary Sony a7 III. Plan for 4K video and 24MP RAW files, and understand its unique dual SD card slot configuration.

faq.question: What card do I need for 4K on the Sony a7 III?
faq.answer: For 4K recording at 100Mbps, you need to use a U3 / V30 rated SD card. For best performance, this card should be placed in Slot 1, which is the faster UHS-II compatible slot.

faq.question: Why are the two card slots on the a7 III different?
faq.answer: The a7 III has two SD card slots, but only Slot 1 is the faster UHS-II type. Slot 2 is the slower UHS-I type. For backup recording, the camera's write speed is limited by the slower card in Slot 2.

contentChunks.heroText: The Camera That Changed Everything. Storage Planned.
contentChunks.introParagraph: The Sony a7 III was a revolutionary camera that set a new standard for full-frame mirrorless performance. Our calculator helps you manage storage for its excellent 4K video and 24MP RAW photos.

sony-a7-iii.notes: The different speeds of the dual card slots is a key quirk to be aware of. For maximum performance, your fastest card should always be in Slot 1.
commonIssues: The menu system was often criticized as being confusing.
The color science is considered less pleasing out-of-camera than some competitors by some users.
The rear screen is not fully articulating.

seo.title: DJI Osmo Action 4 Storage Calculator | 4K 120fps & D-Log
seo.description: Calculate recording time for the DJI Osmo Action 4. Plan storage for its excellent low-light 4K 120fps video and 10-bit D-Log M color.

faq.question: What card does the DJI Action 4 need?
faq.answer: DJI requires a V30-rated microSD card to reliably record 4K 120fps video at its 130Mbps bitrate.

faq.question: What is 10-bit D-Log M?
faq.answer: 10-bit color captures over a billion shades (compared to 16 million in 8-bit), and D-Log M is a flat color profile. Together, they provide much more flexibility for color grading your footage in post-production.

contentChunks.heroText: Low Light, High Action. Storage Calculated.
contentChunks.introParagraph: The DJI Osmo Action 4 excels in low light thanks to its larger sensor and offers pro-level 10-bit color. Use our calculator to make sure you have enough space for all your high-bitrate 4K footage.

dji-osmo-action-4.notes: The Action 4 is praised for its magnetic quick-release mounting system, making it easy to switch between setups. It is waterproof up to 18 meters without a case.
commonIssues: The wide field of view can have noticeable distortion at the edges.
Battery life decreases significantly in cold temperatures.
File sizes for 10-bit video are larger than standard 8-bit video.

seo.title: Insta360 GO 3 Storage & Recording Time Calculator
seo.description: Calculate how much 2.7K video the tiny, wearable Insta360 GO 3 can record. Plan for its unique Action Pod and internal storage system.

faq.question: Does the Insta360 GO 3 use an SD card?
faq.answer: No, the GO 3 camera itself does not use an SD card. It comes with built-in internal storage (available in 32GB, 64GB, or 128GB models). You cannot expand this storage.

faq.question: How long can a 64GB GO 3 record?
faq.answer: The 64GB version of the Insta360 GO 3 can record approximately 1.7 hours of 2.7K 30fps video at its 80Mbps bitrate.

contentChunks.heroText: The Tiny Mighty Action Cam. Know Your Limit.
contentChunks.introParagraph: The Insta360 GO 3 is a uniquely tiny and versatile wearable camera. Since it has fixed internal storage, our calculator is crucial for understanding exactly how much footage you can capture before needing to offload it.

insta360-go-3.notes: The camera module is tiny and magnetic, while the 'Action Pod' acts as a housing, remote control, charger, and flip screen. You must choose your storage size (32, 64, or 128GB) at the time of purchase.
commonIssues: Fixed internal storage means you can't just swap a card when you're full.
The camera can overheat if recording for long periods outside of the Action Pod.
Video quality is not as high as larger action cameras like GoPro or DJI Action.

seo.title: Insta360 ONE X2 360° Storage & Recording Time Calculator
seo.description: Calculate how much 5.7K 360-degree video your Insta360 ONE X2 can record. Plan your microSD card capacity for immersive video capture.

faq.question: What is the best card for an Insta360 ONE X2?
faq.answer: Insta360 requires a V30-rated microSD card to reliably handle the 100Mbps bitrate of its 5.7K 360° video recording.

faq.question: How much 360° video fits on a 128GB card?
faq.answer: A 128GB card will store approximately 2.8 hours of 5.7K 360° video from the ONE X2.

contentChunks.heroText: The Pocket 360 Crew. Plan Your Shoot.
contentChunks.introParagraph: The Insta360 ONE X2 made high-quality 360° video accessible and fun. Our calculator helps you choose the right size V30 microSD card to capture all your immersive adventures.

insta360-one-x2.notes: The 'invisible selfie stick' effect is a key feature of Insta360's 360 cameras. The ONE X2 is waterproof to 10 meters.
commonIssues: The lenses are exposed and can be easily scratched if not handled carefully.
Editing 360° footage can be a learning curve for beginners.
Battery life is shorter when recording in 360° mode.

seo.title: Blackmagic Pocket 6K Pro Storage Calculator | BRAW & ProRes
seo.description: Calculate recording times for the BMPCC 6K Pro. Plan storage for various Blackmagic RAW (BRAW) and ProRes codecs on CFast 2.0 and SD cards.

faq.question: What card do I need to record 6K BRAW on the Pocket 6K Pro?
faq.answer: To record 6K BRAW at higher quality settings (like 3:1 or 5:1), you must use a fast CFast 2.0 card. Some lower bitrate BRAW and ProRes options can be recorded to a V90-rated SD card.

faq.question: How much 6K BRAW 5:1 footage fits on a 256GB card?
faq.answer: A 256GB CFast 2.0 card can hold about 32 minutes of 6K 50fps BRAW at a 5:1 compression ratio (1056Mbps). RAW video consumes storage very quickly.

contentChunks.heroText: Hollywood in Your Hands. Storage Mastered.
contentChunks.introParagraph: The Blackmagic Pocket Cinema Camera 6K Pro is a true digital film camera. Our calculator is an indispensable tool for DPs and filmmakers to plan media needs for its demanding BRAW and ProRes formats.

bmpcc-6k-pro.notes: The camera has one CFast 2.0 slot and one UHS-II SD slot. It also supports recording directly to an external SSD via the USB-C port, which is often the most cost-effective solution for long takes.
commonIssues: The camera has notoriously poor battery life and is almost always used with external power solutions.
It is a cinema camera, not a hybrid stills camera; its still photo capabilities are very basic.
The autofocus is not reliable for tracking moving subjects.

seo.title: Eufy SoloCam S340 Storage Calculator | 3K Continuous Recording
seo.description: Calculate how many days of 3K surveillance footage your solar-powered Eufy SoloCam S340 can store on a High Endurance microSD card.

faq.question: Why do I need a 'High Endurance' card for my Eufy camera?
faq.answer: If you enable continuous 24/7 recording, the camera is constantly writing data. This intense workload will wear out a normal card quickly. High Endurance cards are built to withstand this constant use for years.

faq.question: How many days of 3K video can a 128GB card hold?
faq.answer: A 128GB High Endurance card can store about 37 days of continuous 3K video from the SoloCam S340 before it begins to loop record.

contentChunks.heroText: Non-Stop Solar Security. Know Your Capacity.
contentChunks.introParagraph: The Eufy Security SoloCam S340 offers endless power with its integrated solar panel and 24/7 recording to local storage. Our calculator helps you choose the right High Endurance card to maximize your recording history.

eufy-solocam-s340.notes: Always use High Endurance cards for any security camera set to continuous recording to avoid premature card failure. The camera supports up to 128GB microSD cards.
commonIssues: Solar charging effectiveness depends heavily on direct sunlight exposure.
Continuous recording will drain the battery faster than event-based recording, especially on cloudy days.
Initial Wi-Fi setup requires the camera to be close to your router.

seo.title: Nextbase 622GW Dash Cam Storage & 4K Loop Recording Calculator
seo.description: Calculate loop recording time for the Nextbase 622GW 4K dash cam. Understand why Nextbase requires specific U3 High Endurance cards.

faq.question: Why does Nextbase insist on U3 High Endurance cards?
faq.answer: 4K loop recording is very demanding. Nextbase specifies U3 High Endurance cards to guarantee stable performance, prevent file corruption, and ensure your warranty is not voided. Using a non-compliant card can lead to recording failures.

faq.question: How many hours of 4K driving can a 128GB card record?
faq.answer: A 128GB card will store approximately 9.5 hours of 4K 30fps footage on the 622GW before the camera begins overwriting the oldest, unprotected files.

contentChunks.heroText: Your Ultimate 4K Witness. Never Miss a Second.
contentChunks.introParagraph: The Nextbase 622GW is a top-of-the-line 4K dash cam with advanced features like image stabilization and what3words integration. Our calculator helps you select a compatible High Endurance card to ensure every moment is captured reliably.

nextbase-622gw.notes: Nextbase is very strict about their card requirements. Using a non-Nextbase branded or non-compliant card can lead to performance issues and may void your warranty.
commonIssues: The companion MyNextbase Connect app can be slow and buggy.
The polarizing filter that reduces glare is an optional extra.
Requires a hardwiring kit to enable the intelligent parking mode feature.

seo.title: VIOFO A229 Duo Storage & Dual Channel Loop Recording Calculator
seo.description: Calculate loop recording time for the VIOFO A229 Duo 2K front and rear dash cam. Find the right High Endurance card for stable dual-channel recording.

faq.question: What card does VIOFO recommend for the A229 Duo?
faq.answer: VIOFO mandates the use of a V30-rated High Endurance microSD card. Recording two channels of high-bitrate 2K video simultaneously is very stressful on a card, and a high-quality endurance card is necessary for stability.

faq.question: How much footage does a 256GB card hold?
faq.answer: With both cameras recording, the total bitrate is around 50Mbps. A 256GB card will store about 11 hours of front and rear footage before loop recording begins.

contentChunks.heroText: Front and Rear Protection. Calculated Reliability.
contentChunks.introParagraph: The VIOFO A229 Duo provides high-quality 2K 60fps coverage for both the front and rear of your vehicle. Our calculator helps you choose a robust High Endurance card that can handle the demands of dual-channel recording.

viofo-a229-duo.notes: The stated bitrate of 25Mbps is per channel. The total write load on the card is higher. Always format the card in the dash cam for best results.
commonIssues: The rear camera cable is thick and can be challenging to hide neatly during installation.
Wi-Fi transfer speeds for downloading clips can be slow.
Requires a separate hardwiring kit for parking mode functionality.

seo.title: Panasonic Lumix S1H Storage Calculator | 6K Cinema & V-Log
seo.description: Calculate recording times for the Netflix-approved Panasonic Lumix S1H. Plan media for 6K video, 4K ALL-I codecs, and professional cinema workflows.

faq.question: What card do I need for the best quality on the Lumix S1H?
faq.answer: For nearly all of the S1H's high-bitrate modes, including 6K video and 4K 60fps ALL-Intra (400Mbps), a V90-rated UHS-II SD card is mandatory. The camera will not allow you to record in these modes without one.

faq.question: Why is the S1H 'Netflix-approved'?
faq.answer: The S1H was the first mirrorless camera to be officially approved by Netflix for use as a primary camera on their productions, a testament to its image quality, reliability, and professional codec options.

contentChunks.heroText: The Cinema Mirrorless. Master Your Media.
contentChunks.introParagraph: The Panasonic Lumix S1H blurred the lines between mirrorless and cinema cameras with its 6K resolution and robust feature set. Our calculator is essential for planning storage for its demanding, professional-grade video formats.

panasonic-lumix-s1h.notes: The S1H has dual UHS-II SD card slots. It also features a built-in fan to allow for unlimited recording time without overheating, a key cinema feature.
commonIssues: The autofocus system is contrast-based and is not as reliable as modern phase-detect systems.
It is a very large and heavy camera for a mirrorless model.
The sheer number of recording formats and settings can be daunting.

seo.title: Nikon Z8 Storage Calculator | 8K N-RAW & Pro Video
seo.description: Calculate storage for the 'baby Z9', the Nikon Z8. Plan for internal 8K 60fps N-RAW, ProRes RAW, and its dual CFexpress/SD card workflow.

faq.question: What card is required for 8K RAW video on the Nikon Z8?
faq.answer: To record 8K N-RAW video, which can have bitrates exceeding 3500Mbps, a very fast CFexpress Type B card is mandatory. This format cannot be recorded to the SD card slot.

faq.question: How much 8K N-RAW footage can a 512GB card hold?
faq.answer: A 512GB CFexpress card can hold approximately 20 minutes of 8K 30fps N-RAW footage. RAW video at this resolution requires massive amounts of storage.

contentChunks.heroText: The Z9 in a smaller body. Storage, Unleashed.
contentChunks.introParagraph: The Nikon Z8 packs almost all the power of the flagship Z9 into a more compact body, including internal 8K RAW video. Our calculator is a critical tool for planning media needs for this incredibly powerful hybrid camera.

nikon-z8.notes: The Z8 has one CFexpress Type B slot and one UHS-II SD slot. For any serious video or high-speed burst work, the CFexpress slot should be used.
commonIssues: CFexpress cards are expensive, and the Z8's RAW video formats will encourage you to buy large ones.
RAW video workflows are demanding on computer hardware and storage infrastructure.
Some early units were part of a recall for a lens mount issue.

seo.title: Blackmagic Pocket 4K Storage Calculator | BRAW & ProRes
seo.description: Calculate recording times for the revolutionary BMPCC 4K. Plan storage for various Blackmagic RAW (BRAW) and ProRes formats on CFast 2.0 and SD cards.

faq.question: What card do I need to record 4K BRAW on the Pocket 4K?
faq.answer: For high-quality 4K 60fps BRAW (e.g., 3:1), you must use a CFast 2.0 card or an external SSD. Lower compression BRAW (e.g., 12:1) at 24/30fps can be recorded to a fast V90-rated SD card.

faq.question: Is the BMPCC 4K still a good camera?
faq.answer: Absolutely. It democratized RAW video and remains one of the best value-for-money cinema cameras on the market, producing a beautiful, flexible image perfect for color grading.

contentChunks.heroText: The RAW Video Revolution. Storage Planned.
contentChunks.introParagraph: The Blackmagic Pocket Cinema Camera 4K changed the game for indie filmmakers. Our calculator is an essential tool for managing your media across CFast, SD, or external SSDs for its flexible BRAW and ProRes codecs.

bmpcc-4k.notes: The most popular and cost-effective way to record on the BMPCC 4K is by using a Samsung T5/T7 SSD connected via the USB-C port.
commonIssues: Abysmal internal battery life; external power is a must.
The large screen is not fully articulating.
The autofocus is practically unusable for anything other than a single tap-to-focus.
